instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3462 Trackpad is shacking (sometimes)
threads.message:
Hi there,

I have macbook for repair that has a strange trackpad symptoms. The cursor starts shacking (going left and right) even if the fingure on trackpad is very steady (like on Monday morning and not on Saturday after party). It does that randomly (like once in half an hour) then goes back to normal. Replaced trackpad and flex cable, turned the heater on but still shacking. Any idea whats going on here?

Thanks!

threads.title: 820-3462 Trackpad is shacking (sometimes)
threads.message: Does it happen with charger connected or also on battery alone?

threads.title: 820-3462 Trackpad is shacking (sometimes)
threads.message: Good question. Today when I tested it for over an hours with my charger and without charger. It didnt have this problem. I asked the customer if she has original apple charge and she said no. So I told her to observe if does have this issue only when charger is connected then we know if that is the charger case. Will post here later.

threads.title: 820-3462 Trackpad is shacking (sometimes)
threads.message: Yeah, shit Chinese chargers will mess with the trackpad in the best case. The worst case we all have seen before too of course...
